description: An examination of selected texts from the pre-Socratic philosophers, Plato, Aristotle, as well as philosophers of the Stoic, Epicurean and Sceptic schools of thought. The emphasis may vary from year to year, and may focus on ethics, epistemology, metaphysics, logic, or philosophy of mind.
title: Greek Thinkers
prerequisite:
Cohort 2012-2014 Completed 80MCs, including 28 MCs in PH or 28 MCs in EU/LA(French/German)/ recognised modules or 28MCs in GL/GL recognised non- language modules, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track. 

Cohort 2015-2019: Completed 80MCs, including 28 MCs in PH or 28 MCs in EU/LA(French/German/ Spanish)/recognised modules or 28MCs in GL/GL recognised non-language modules, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.

Cohort 2020 onwards: Completed 80MCs, including 28 MCs in PH or 28 MCs in EU/LA(French/German/ Spanish)/recognised modules, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
